title: 105_hr306
content: The Act titled "Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act of 1997" prohibits health insurance discrimination based on genetic information. It amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to include this prohibition. The Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act of 1997 prohibits health insurance discrimination based on genetic information for medical care under group health plans or coverage offered by health insurance issuers. It also limits the collection and disclosure of genetic information by group health plans and insurance issuers. The Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act prohibits the disclosure of genetic information without prior authorization from the participant or beneficiary. Authorization is required for each disclosure and must identify the recipient. The Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act defines genetic information as information about genes, gene products, or inherited characteristics. It also defines genetic services as health services provided to obtain, assess, and interpret genetic information for diagnostic and therapeutic purposes, and for genetic education and counseling. The Act also specifies that disclosure of genetic information requires authorization from the individual or family member. The Genetic Information Nondiscrimination in Health Insurance Act defines genetic information and services.
